intro: Chlorophytum nervatum, commonly known as the narrow-veined spider plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features long, arching leaves with a bluish-green hue and prominent, parallel veins that give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers in clusters, which are followed by bright red berries. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight. Chlorophytum nervatum is popular as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
